meanings.sent1: She was reluct to try the new food.
meanings.sent2: He always seems reluct to join group activities.
meanings.sent3: The cat was reluct to come out from under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The old car engine was reluct to start in the cold weather.
meanings.sent5: The student was reluct to raise her hand in class.

meanings.sent1: The reluct student didn't want to give the presentation.
meanings.sent2: He felt reluct to speak up in front of the large crowd.
meanings.sent3: The dog gave a reluct bark before approaching the stranger.
meanings.sent4: The tree stood reluct to shed its leaves in the early autumn.
meanings.sent5: Her reluct expression showed her lack of enthusiasm for the task.
